answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.It could be that your symptoms of chronic urinary infections are recurring. But it could also be that the kidneys are likely to be infected resulting in Pyelonephritis, as with your history of chronic urinary infections, this can spread up and affect the kidneys. An ultrasonography and kidney function tests can help diagnose this. Hope diabetes has been ruled out.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: Hello,Just looking for some insight on my situation.  I am 30 years old, I have had frequent UTI's since I was about 19 years of age.  I saw a urologist back when I was about 25, had ultrasounds and exams they could not find a cause of my UTI's, so I was put on a preventative daily antibiotic for a couple of years and it curred my UTI's while on the antibiotics.All was good then at 28 I became pregnant with my son and quit taking the antibiotics.  Everything was perfect during my pregnancy I didn't have a UTI once.  As soon as I deliver my son they start reappearing.  My son is 19 months old and I have had 5 in the past 7 months.  This last one had me with a fever of 103, severe pain, blood in the urine and diagnosed with a kideny infection.  I had a follow up yesterday to confirm there is no more infection, but I am still having symptoms. I am seeing a urologist again next week, but could this be a kidney stone or a more serious problem?  Even with my urinasysis coming up clean?  I have still not gotten the result of growth after 48 hours, but there was no blood or sign of infection intially.
